1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn

2.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

4.brief: properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
something occupied; a conquest; also a patrimony
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

6.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
a year (as a revolution of time)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling

7.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, to weigh out; by implication, to allot or constitute officially; also to enumerate or enroll
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

8.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
